solution.text:
Let the number of shirts Stitched today be x.
Therefore, the amount he earned (in rupees) per shirt today = x - _{i}_
So,
The total amount he earned (in rupees) today = \(x\times (x-_{i}_)\)
Today he earned _{k}_ rupees
Therefore, \(x\times (x-_{i}_) = _{k}_\)
i.e., \(x^2 - _{i}_x = _{k}_\)
i.e., \(x^2 - _{i}_x - _{k}_ = 0\)
Therefore, the number of shirts stitched today satisfies the quadratic equation :
\(x^2 - _{i}_x - _{k}_ = 0\)
which is the required representation of the problem mathematically.

content.text:
Represent the following situation mathematically:
A tailor stitches certain numbers of shirts in a day.He earns on each shirt _{i}_ rupees less than the number of shirts stitched in a day. Today he earned _{k}_ rupees.Find the number of shirts he stitched today.
